greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime p such that p>n and 2*n-p is also prime.
comment: Values of q from A143697. This follows from the factorization n^2-k^2 = (n-k)(n+k).
link: P. CAMI, Table of n, a(n) for n = 4..60000
formula: n>3 integer; a(n)=min{p: p>n; p, 2*n-p are primes}.
mathematica: Table[p=n+1; q=2n-p; While[q>0&&!(PrimeQ[p]&&PrimeQ[q]), p++; q-- ]; p, {n, 4, 100}]
program: (PARI) a(n) = {my(p=nextprime(n+1)); while(!isprime(2*n-p), p = nextprime(p+1)); p;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 22 2016
results.author: Serhat Sevki Dincer (sevki(AT)ug.bilkent.edu.tr), Nov 26 2002
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 24 2009 at the suggestion of _R. J. Mathar_ and _T. D. Noe_.
